contentData.text:
Want to live life to the full?

 We have discussion groups running for 7-session each. We looking at the Bible and discuss together. Whoever you are, whatever you are thinking, these groups are a place for you to discover the greatest gift in the universe.

 

We're starting new groups regularly.

If you're interested, email info@stphilemons.co.uk

Our groups are more than just Bible studies: they include prayer, encouragement, sharing what God is doing in our lives, accountability, and working together in the mission of telling others about Jesus.

contentData.title: What are Life Groups?
contentData.text:
Life Groups are small communities of 6-12 people meeting in homes in Toxteth during the week. We have men’s, women’s and mixed groups.

 

These groups are the primary place where the gospel is applied to real life issues. They are at the heart of St Philemon’s pastoral care. Each group is led by trained leaders, who themselves receive continued support and oversight.

 

Each group meets with the expectation that Jesus speaks through the Bible to transform and renew lives.

contentData.title: Why are Life Groups important?
contentData.text:
A PLACE TO APPLY THE GOSPEL TO OUR LIVES

We need others to help us apply the truth about the gospel to our daily lives. The implications of our life with Christ are broad – so broad that we rarely understand them by ourselves. As we remind one another about grace, we help each other open our lives to transformation according to God’s purposes.

 

A PLACE FOR CARING FOR EACH OTHER

The Bible tells us to ‘encourage, serve, rejoice, weep with, correct, instruct, sing to, build up, accept, and love one another.’ These commands are best followed in personal relationships. Life Groups also serve to keep St Philemon’s leaders aware of pastoral concerns or troubles facing members of the church family.

 

A PLACE TO GROW

Life Groups are a place where spiritual gifts are discerned and developed. Members are encouraged not merely to attend or ‘consume’, but to invest themselves in relationships with other members, actively looking to support one another in a variety of ways.

contentData.title: How much commitment does a Life Group require?
contentData.text:
In 2019, groups will meet 24 times. Regular attendance helps, so we encourage people to come as consistently as they can. If you have to miss a week, think how you can follow up with others in the group that week. Life Groups do require your effort to become a meaningful, rich experience. Therefore think how you can invest in yours.

 

You are welcome to try out a group a few times before committing to it. If you would like to find out more, email info@stphilemons.co.uk or contact Brian or any Group leader you know.

contentData.title: Locations and times
contentData.text:

At church

For men and women (with a crèche)

 

Mark & Sarah's Group

Thursdays, 7.15pm

151 Upper Hill St

For men and women

Looking after children brings particular joys and challenges, and we want to care for you in them. We believe we do this best by supporting you in your relationship with Jesus.  

 

We try to provide opportunities for you to listen to God's Word without the distraction of children. We also give chances to meet with others to discuss the Bible, share burdens, pray, and to reach out to our community. Find out more: Crèche and Mini Phillies; Monday Life Group

Every Sunday evening we take a look at a particular topic as a church. Topics range from meeting a mission partner or discussing something going on at church, to digging deeper into an issue in the Bible. Main services can be busy so this gives us a bit more time. We never expect people to come every week: just come for the topics that interest or will help you.

 

We usually serve food straight after the evening service, at 6.15pm, then the session runs from 6.45-7.45pm.

'Food for Thought' is a chance to have something to eat, spend time with other people, have some fun and also hear something interesting about Jesus and the difference he makes.

 

We meet every Monday in term time (if in doubt, check the calendar), from 12.30 to 2pm in the church building. All are welcome. It's a great way to get to know some new, friendly people.

 

We begin with soup and sandwiches. Then there is a short message from the Bible, followed by quizzes and prizes. We then serve some pudding, tea and coffee. Occasionally we have 'specials'.

How much does it cost? Free! 

When? Every second Friday. You can see the dates on our church calendar. 

What time? 1.15-3.15pm.

Where? St Silas Primary School.

Who can come? Our classes are for women only. We welcome women from all backgrounds and all levels of English. Babies are very welcome too.

 

If you would like more information, or you would like to get involved, please contact Alice Cornes (alice@stphilemons.co.uk or 07815536648).
